text: Each year, Waikiki closes off it's traffic on Kalakaua Avenue
in celebration of Waikiki's annual Spam Jam Street Festival.

Now it's a well-known fact that Hawaii has a love affair 
 with Spam. Although Minnesota was the actual home of Spam,

Hawaii's passion for it actually stems from its history with World 
 War II, when this meat was used as soldier rations.

Thus, it became the ideal soldier meal. As a 
 result, it got into Hawaii's native palette.

Today,  locals consume over 6 million cans of Spam a 
 year. Making it the nation's top consumer of Spam.

What is the number one favorite snack dish?  If you're 
 familiar with local culture, you may already know the answer...

At the Waikiki Spam Jam Street Festival, local restaurants 
 from around the island pitch up tents
to create innovative menus around  Spam.
From Spam chowder, Spam pizzas, Spam lettuce wraps and katsu...
There's even Spam musubi ice pops and Spam cheesecake.

That's why in Hawaii, we say, "It broke 
 the mouth!" ...because it tastes so good.
